climbs.name: X-Files
climbs.fa: bolted by Chris Barnes, Mike Engle, & Vernon Phinney; July 2018

content.description: Start on a steep grey ramp and climb up to a right diagonalling crack.  Burly liebacking and face climbing lead to a slight bulge.  Continuous, hard and sharp in places.
content.location: Just left of deep gash crack like feature on the right side of the formation is a discontinuous right trending crack system.  Climb up a steep grey ramp to gain the crack system.

content.description: Tricky start and rightward traverse leads to better holds in the crack and finish.
content.location: This is the only route on the small crag you come to first if walking up the gully alongside the "danger" signs.

climbs.name: Exodus
climbs.fa: bolted by Mike Engle, Chris Barnes, & Vernon Phinney; July 2018

content.description: Follow a distinctive thin tips crack up and left to small overlap.  Move past overlap on hand jams and continue to a stance and sport anchors below a blocky secton near the top.
content.location: Nearer the left end of the X-Crag, Exodus is continuous left trending crack line and starts about 30 feet uphill from the "X" feature on the left end of the formation.
